message_1: Suppose that we have two propositions P and Q, and that we know that P implies Q is true in intuitionistic logic. If we also know that P is true, what can we say about the truth value of Q?
message_2: If we know that P implies Q is true in intuitionistic logic and that P is true, then we can conclude that Q is also true. In intuitionistic logic, if the implication P â†’ Q is true and P is true, then Q must be true as well.
